Headaches can have various causes. Try resting in a quiet, dark room, apply cold or warm compress, and stay hydrated. If severe or persistent, consult a doctor.
For headache relief: Rest, hydration, over-the-counter pain relievers, and stress management. Seek medical attention for sudden, severe headaches.

patterns: I think I have a cold
responses: Based on your symptoms, you might have a cold or flu. Cold symptoms include runny nose, sneezing, mild cough. Flu typically has fever, body aches, fatigue. Rest, fluids, and symptom management help recovery.
Cold vs Flu: Colds develop gradually with nasal symptoms. Flu starts suddenly with fever, chills, body aches. Both need rest, hydration, and symptomatic treatment. See doctor if symptoms worsen.
For cold/flu: Rest, plenty of fluids, throat lozenges, decongestants if needed. Flu may benefit from antiviral medication if caught early. Monitor for complications.
